net.corda.core.node.services

Enum Vault.RelevancyStatus

  • Enclosing class:
    Vault<T extends ContractState>

    public static enum Vault.RelevancyStatus

    If the querying node is a participant in a state then it is classed as RELEVANT.

    If the querying node is not a participant in a state then it is classed as NOT_RELEVANT. These types of states can still be recorded in the vault if the transaction containing them was recorded with the StatesToRecord.ALL_VISIBLE flag. This will typically happen for things like reference data which can be referenced in transactions as a class ReferencedStateAndRef but cannot be modified by any party but the maintainer.

    If both RELEVANT and NOT_RELEVANT states are required to be returned from a query, then the ALL flag can be used.

    NOTE: Default behaviour is for ALL STATES to be returned as this is how Corda behaved before the introduction of this query criterion.

    See Also:
    StatesToRecord.ALL_VISIBLE, class ReferencedStateAndRef

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • RELEVANT

        public static net.corda.core.node.services.Vault.RelevancyStatus RELEVANT

      • NOT_RELEVANT

        public static net.corda.core.node.services.Vault.RelevancyStatus NOT_RELEVANT

      • ALL

        public static net.corda.core.node.services.Vault.RelevancyStatus ALL
